definition: to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: Unbridled drink it and enjoy, enjoy the ease of food.
sentences.chinese: 肆無忌憚的開懷暢飲，輕鬆自如的享受美食。

sentences.english: The invaders brazened their way into our motherland.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者肆無忌憚地闖入了我們祖國。

sentences.english: Troops indiscriminately massacred the defenceless population.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊肆無忌憚地屠殺手無寸鐵的民衆。

sentences.english: The pirates roamed with impunity, often ransacking and even decimating coastal settlements.
sentences.chinese: 這些盜賊肆無忌憚，經常掠奪甚至殘殺沿海的居民。

sentences.english: They looked at me uncompromisingly as if I was a nice meaty dish.
sentences.chinese: 他們肆無忌憚地瞄着我，好像我是一隻光雞。

sentences.english: With the protection of law enforcement officials, counterfeiters will be more reckless.
sentences.chinese: 由於執法方面的包庇，造假者更加肆無忌憚。

sentences.english: His intemperate (ie thoughtlessly angry or rude) remarks got him into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 他言語肆無忌憚，惹出了是非。

sentences.english: I will laugh unbridled, rampant cry.
sentences.chinese: 我要肆無忌憚的笑，肆意妄爲的哭。

sentences.english: At the end of the war, the land grab by the Chiang government was even more callous and more open.
sentences.chinese: 抗戰結束後，蔣介石政府對土地的侵奪更加肆無忌憚。

sentences.english: Do subordinates, superiors in the face of unbridled drinking.
sentences.chinese: 做下屬的，最忌在上司面前肆無忌憚。

definition: as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
